title: Absorb Elements
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, the spell captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee attack. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage of the triggering type, and the spell ends.

title: Animal Friendship
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">This spell lets you convince a beast that you mean it no harm. Choose a beast that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast's Intelligence is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the beast must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the spell's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spell ends.
text | <span style="font-size:8px">At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot or higher, you can affect one additional beast for each slot level above 1st.

contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 24 hours

text | <span style="font-size:7px">Your magic turns others into beasts. Choose any number of willing creatures that you can see within range. On subsequent turns, you can use your actions to transform affected creatures into new forms.

title: Antilife Shell
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:8px">A shimmering barrier extends out from you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and hedging out creatures other than undead and constructs.

text | <span style="font-size:8px">The barrier lasts for the duration. The barrier prevents an affected creature from passing or reaching through. An affected creature can cast spells or make attacks with ranged or reach weapons through the barrier. If you move so that an affect creature is forced to pass through the barrier, the spell ends.

title: Antipathy/Sympathy
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">This spell attracts or repels creatures of your choice. You target something within range, either a Huge or smaller object or creature or an area that is no larger than a 200-foot cube. Choose antipathy or sympathy as the aura's effect.

contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a huge or smaller beast or plant. The target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence of 3 or less. The target gains an Intelligence of 10. The target also gains the ability to speak one language you know. If the target is a plant, it gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it gains senses similar to a human's. Your DM chooses statistics appropriate for the awakened plant, such as the statistics ... (see ref for full text)

contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:11px">You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target's AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor it is wearing.

title: Beast Bond
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:8px">You establish a telepathic link with one beast you touch that is friendly to you or charmed by you. The spell fails if the beast's Intelligence is 4 or higher. Until the spell ends, the link is active while you and the beast are within line of sight of each other. Through the link, the beast can understand your telepathic messages to it, and it can telepathically communicate simple emotions and concepts back to you. While the link is active, the beast gains advantage on attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you that you can see.

title: Beast Sense (R)
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:11px">You touch a willing beast. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to see through the beast's eyes and hear what it hears, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses.

title: Blight
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. title: Blur
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:10px">Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. title: Bones of the Earth
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">You cause up to six pillars of stone to burst from places on the ground that you can see within range. When reduced to 0 hit points, a pillar crumbles into rubble, which creates an area of difficult terrain with a 10-foot radius. The rubble lasts until cleared.

When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">You briefly become one with nature and gain knowledge of the surrounding territory. text | <span style="font-size:8px">A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws. At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

title: Primordial Ward
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min
text | <span style="font-size:11px">You have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage for the spell's duration.

title: Produce Flame
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. title: Protection from Energy
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour
text | <span style="font-size:11px">For the duration, the willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice - acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

title: Protection from Poison
contents: text | <span style="font-size:9px">You touch a creature. If it is poisoned, you neutralize the poison. If more than one poison afflicts the target, you neutralize on poison that you know is present, or you neutralize one at random.
text | <span style="font-size:9px">For the duration, the target has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and it has resistance to poison damage.

title: Purify Food and Drink (R)
contents: text | <span style="font-size:11px">All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of poison and disease.

title: Regenerate
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains 4d8 + 15 hit points. For the duration of the spell, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns (10 hit points each minute).

text | <span style="font-size:8px">The target's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored after 2 minutes. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

title: Reincarnate
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">You touch a dead humanoid or a piece of a dead humanoid. Provided that the creature has been dead no longer than 10 days, the spell forms a new adult body for it and then calls the soul to enter that body. If the target's soul isn't free or willing to do so, the spell fails.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">The magic fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's race to change. title: Resistance
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:11px">You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one saving throw of its choice. It can roll the die before or after the saving throw. The spell then ends.

title: Reverse Gravity
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">This spell reverses gravity in a 50-foot-radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall upward and reach the top of the area when you cast this spell. A creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, thus avoiding the fall.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or crea... (see ref for full text)

title: Scrying
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

title: Shape Water
contents: text | <span style="font-size:11px">You choose an area of water that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways.

title: Shapechange
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You assume the form of a different creature for the duration. The new form can be any creature with a challenge rating equal to your level or lower. The creature can't be a construct or an undead, and you must have seen the sort of creature at least once. You transform into an average example of that creature, one without any class levels or the Spellcasting trait.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen creature, though you retain your alignment and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores You also retain all of ... (see ref for full text)

title: Shillelagh
contents: text | <span style="font-size:9px">The wood of a club or quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a d8. The weapon also becomes magical, if it isn't already. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

title: Silence (R)
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:9px">For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

title: Skywrite (R)
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:10px">You cause up to ten words to form in a part of the sky you can see. The words appear to be made of cloud and remain in place for the spell's duration. The words dissipate when the spell ends. A strong wind can disperse the clouds and end the spell early.

title: Sleet Storm
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls prone. If a creature is concentrating in the spell's area, the creature must make a succ... (see ref for full text)

title: Slow
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn. If the creature attempts to cast a spell wit... (see ref for full text)

title: Speak with Animals (R)
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

title: Speak with Plants
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">You imbue plants within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question plants about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You can also turn difficult terrain caused by plant growth (such as thickets and undergrowth) into ordinary terrain that lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where plants are present into difficult terr... (see ref for full text)

title: Spider Climb
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:11px">Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving its hands free. The target also gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed.

title: Spike Growth
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:8px">The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

text | <span style="font-size:8px">The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is case must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

title: Stinking Cloud
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw. A moderate wind (at l... (see ref for full text)

title: Stone Shape
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">You touch a stone object of Medium size or smaller or a section of stone no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, idol, or coffer, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a stone door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

title: Stoneskin
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:11px">This spell turns the flesh of a willing creature you touch as hard as stone. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

title: Storm of Vengeance
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">A churning storm cloud forms, centered on a point you can see and spreading to a radius of 360 feet. Lightning flashes in the area, thunder booms, and strong winds roar. Each creature under the cloud (no more than 5,000 feet beneath the cloud) when it appears must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 thunder damage and becomes deafened for 5 minutes.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">Each round you maintain concentration on this spell, the storm produces additional effects on your turn. Round 2: Acidic rain falls from the cloud. Each crea... (see ref for full text)

title: Sunbeam
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">A beam of brilliant light flashes out from your hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 radiant damage and is blinded until your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded by this spell. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You can create a new line of radiance as your action on any turn until the spell ends. For the duration, a mote of brilliant radiance shines in your hand. It sheds ... (see ref for full text)

title: Sunburst
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">Brilliant sunlight flashes in a 60-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that light must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 12d6 radiant damage and is blinded for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded by this spell. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">A creature blinded by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer blinded. This spel... (see ref for full text)

title: Thorn Whip
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes 1d6 piercing damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.
text | <span style="font-size:8px">This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

title: Thunderclap
contents: text | <span style="font-size:11px">You create a burst of thunderous sound, which can be heard 100 feet away. Each creature other than you within 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 thunder damage.

title: Thunderwave
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

title: Tidal Wave
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">You conjure up a wave of water that crashes down on an area within range. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 30 feet of it.

title: Transmute Rock
contents: text | <span style="font-size:11px">You choose an area of stone or mud that you can see that fits within a 40-foot cube and that is within range, and choose one of the following effects.

title: Transport via Plants
contents: text | <span style="font-size:9px">This spell creates a magical link between a Large or larger inanimate plant within range and another plant, at any distance, on the same plane of existence. You must have seen or touched the destination plant at least once before. For the duration, any creature can step into the target plant and exit from the destination plant by using 5 feet of movement.

title: Tree Stride
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You gain the ability to enter a tree and move from inside it to inside another tree of the same kind within 500 feet. Both trees must be living and at least the same size as you. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter a tree. You instantly know the location of all other trees of the same kind within 500 feet and, as part of the move used to enter the tree, can either pass into one of those trees or step out of the tree you're in. You appear in a spot of your choice within 5 feet of the destination tree, using another 5 feet of movement. If yo... (see ref for full text)

title: True Resurrection
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 200 years and that died for any reason except old age. If the creature's soul is free and willing, the creature is restored to life with all its hit points.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">This spell closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses affecting the creature when it died. The spell replaces damaged or missing organs or limbs. The spell can even provide a new body if the original no longer exists, in which case you must speak the creature's name. title: Tsunami
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 6 rounds

text | <span style="font-size:7px">A wall of water springs into existence at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 300 feet long, 300 feet high, and 50 feet thick. The wall lasts for the duration.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d10 bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. title: Wall of Fire
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

title: Wall of Stone
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:7px">A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall is 6 inches thick and is composed of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with at least on other panel. Alternatively, you can create 10-foot-by-20-foot panels that are only 3 inches thick.

title: Wall of Thorns
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You create a wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

title: Wall of Water
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins

text | <span style="font-size:9px">You conjure up a wall of water on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall vanishes when the spell ends. The wall's space is difficult terrain.

title: Warding Wind
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 10 mins
text | <span style="font-size:11px">A strong wind (20 miles per hour) blows around you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you. The wind lasts for the spell's duration.

title: Water Breathing (R)
contents: text | <span style="font-size:11px">This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

title: Water Walk (R)
contents: text | <span style="font-size:8px">This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface - such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava - as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.
text | <span style="font-size:8px">If your target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

title: Watery Sphere
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:11px">You conjure up a sphere of water with a 10-foot radius on a point you can see within range. The sphere can hover in the air, but no more than 10 feet off the ground. The sphere remains for the spell's duration.

title: Web
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 hour

text | <span style="font-size:7px">You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot cube from that point for the duration. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet. Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them ... (see ref for full text)

title: Whirlwind
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:9px">A whirlwind howls down to a point on the ground you specify. The whirlwind is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up any Medium or smaller objects that aren't secured to anything and that aren't worn or carried by anyone.

title: Wind Walk
contents: text | <span style="font-size:7px">You and up to ten willing creatures you can see within range assume a gaseous form for the duration, appearing as wisps of cloud. While in this cloud form, a creature has a flying speed of 300 feet and has resistance to damage from nonmagical weapons. The only actions a creature can take in this form are the Dash action or to revert to its normal form. Reverting takes 1 minute, during which time a creature is incapacitated and can't move. Until the spell ends, a creature can revert to cloud form, which also requires the 1-minute transformation.... (see ref for full text)

title: Wind Wall
contents: property | Duration | Concentration, up to 1 min

text | <span style="font-size:7px">A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.

text | <span style="font-size:7px">When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw.
